intro: Cerastium decalvans subsp. dollineri, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species in certain regions.
